aston.nabneyit.util

Class LayeredFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • aston.nabneyit.util.LayeredFactory

  • public class LayeredFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    Defines a factory as a series of layers, with each unit in each layer connected to unit(s) in the next layer. It assumes that either a single intelligent router is used between all units in each layer multiConnectLayers(int) or that the two layers have the same number of units and corresponding units are connected (to a single unit in each case) directConnectLayers(int).
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Ian T. Nabney

    • Field Detail

      • layers

        private Layer[] layers

      • connections

        private Connector[][] connections
        Stores connectors between layers. This 2d array stores an array of connectors for each layer, as direct connections require one connector per unit.

        public boolean check()
        Make basic checks on viability of layered factory: must be some units in each layer and that connections are present
        Returns:
        true if layered factory is OK

      • multiConnectLayers

        public void multiConnectLayers(int i)
        Connects a specified layer to its following layer using a single intelligent router.
        Parameters:
        i - index of first layer in connection
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of range

      • directConnectLayers

        public void directConnectLayers(int i)
        Connects a specified layer to its following layer using one connector per pair of corresponding units.
        Parameters:
        i - index of first layer in connection
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index is out of range
        ConnectionException - if the number of units in each layer is not the same
